post.title: I'm not a ruqqus admin, I'm a ruqqus discord mod.

body:
>Why do you paranoid schizoid fucktards think that da Joos are behind literally *everything*?

Because it's simply true that Jews have an absolutely insane amount of institutional power and control. Just take a quick glance at [this](https://imgur.com/gallery/dBvQh) infographic in order to get a better idea of the totally ridiculous amount of control that they have over the American media. Jews also have a long, proud tradition of weaseling their way into every single site or institution that provides a platform to people so that they can censor politically incorrect wrongthink since platforms that tolerate politically incorrect wrongthink also tolerate anti-Jewish views. 

And besides, accusing the admins of being crypto-Jews is only being done half-seriously since even within the Alt-Right we like to joke about everything being a Jewish conspiracy.

Regardless, the real issue here is the fact that there's literally a small cabal of leftists on Discord that are trying to purge Alt-Right people from Ruqqus just like they did from Reddit while hiding behind the facade of being trolls. And the admins seem to be besties with them. That's what's pissing us off. That's a pretty clear sign that the admins also want to purge the Alt-Right from Ruqqus, or at least purge their content from the front page in order to limit their reach. And so of course we're going to chimp out when the admins are siding with the same people that ruined Reddit.

post.title: I'm not a ruqqus admin, I'm a ruqqus discord mod.

author.bio:
* *Greg*. | Haole originally from Hawaii. (Haole = "He without breath.", i.e. White Boy)
* Associates in InfoSec + Network Support | CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+
* Ruqqus Discord Jannie, IrreleventIdiot#8516

author.bio_html:
• Greg. | Haole originally from Hawaii. (Haole = "He without breath.", i.e. White Boy)
  • Associates in InfoSec + Network Support | CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+
  • Ruqqus Discord Jannie, IrreleventIdiot#8516
  • PCMR | Patriot | Super Straight

body:
I actually avoid filtered words, and I know I've backtracked if I accidentally didn't. I literally don't participate in channels that aren't in my purview. When have I posted banned gifs? Breaking minor rules happens, and it doesn't always get caught like it should even for regular users.

Basically, we aren't perfect, but the whole point of mods is to be given special responsibility and be trustworthy with it. You seem to have a fear of anyone anywhere having any slight bit more priviliage than you do. There are some things where systems should be put in place to prevent bad blood. But in the end it all comes down to what you the individual choose to do.

I treat my mod position seriously, and as such have been constantly vying to improve the rules for the discord towhere there's less friction and issue a user can take with mods.
body_html:

Basically, we aren't perfect, but the whole point of mods is to be given special responsibility and be trustworthy with it. You seem to have a fear of anyone anywhere having any slight bit more priviliage than you do. There are some things where systems should be put in place to prevent bad blood. But in the end it all comes down to what you the individual choose to do.

I treat my mod position seriously, and as such have been constantly vying to improve the rules for the discord towhere there's less friction and issue a user can take with mods.

body:
Then you are doing your job well. But there are other mods I've seen who definitely do abuse it, and the admins are blatantly okay with and even encourage it.

As for breaking rules the bypassing of restrictions itself could be considered one, but I've also seen them be rude or say offensive things and post gifs that aren't allowed etc. And they're allowed to get away with it. Some of them even pin their messages just so everyone sees them because they're more important than everyone else (and I mean regular messages, not mod notices).

parent.body:
I actually avoid filtered words, and I know I've backtracked if I accidentally didn't. I literally don't participate in channels that aren't in my purview. When have I posted banned gifs? Breaking minor rules happens, and it doesn't always get caught like it should even for regular users.

Basically, we aren't perfect, but the whole point of mods is to be given special responsibility and be trustworthy with it. You seem to have a fear of anyone anywhere having any slight bit more priviliage than you do. There are some things where systems should be put in place to prevent bad blood. But in the end it all comes down to what you the individual choose to do.

I treat my mod position seriously, and as such have been constantly vying to improve the rules for the discord towhere there's less friction and issue a user can take with mods.
parent.body_html:
I actually avoid filtered words, and I know I've backtracked if I accidentally didn't. I literally don't participate in channels that aren't in my purview. When have I posted banned gifs? Breaking minor rules happens, and it doesn't always get caught like it should even for regular users.

Basically, we aren't perfect, but the whole point of mods is to be given special responsibility and be trustworthy with it. You seem to have a fear of anyone anywhere having any slight bit more priviliage than you do. There are some things where systems should be put in place to prevent bad blood. But in the end it all comes down to what you the individual choose to do.

I treat my mod position seriously, and as such have been constantly vying to improve the rules for the discord towhere there's less friction and issue a user can take with mods.
